pt: {sc}despondent{/sc} {sc}despairing{/sc} {sc}desperate{/sc} {sc}hopeless{/sc} mean having lost all or nearly all hope. {sc}despondent{/sc} implies a deep dejection arising from a conviction of the uselessness of further effort.
{sc}despairing{/sc} suggests the slipping away of all hope and often despondency.

pt.t: {it}despairing{/it} appeals for the return of the kidnapped child

pt: {sc}desperate{/sc} implies despair that prompts reckless action or violence in the face of defeat or frustration.

pt.t: one last {it}desperate{/it} attempt to turn the tide of battle

pt: {sc}hopeless{/sc} suggests despair and the cessation of effort or resistance and often implies acceptance or resignation.

pt.t: the situation of the trapped miners is {it}hopeless{/it}
